clinical_study.brief_title: Sacral Nerve Stimulation for Anal Incontinence and Bowel Control
clinical_study.official_title: Sacral Nerve Stimulation for Anal Incontinence and Bowel Control

brief_summary.textblock: Multicenter European study to evaluate efficacy and safety of sacral nerve stimulation with InterStim Therapy to treat fecal incontinence or constipation

primary_outcome.measure: FI - number of FI episodes per week and/or number of days with FI per week. Constipation - number of bowel movements per week; &/or decrease defecations requiring straining; &/or decrease defecations where there was incomplete emptying

secondary_outcome.measure: FI-number of days with staining/week;urgency with continent bowel movements; Improvement in QOL;* Improvement in anal canal pressure. Constipation - Improvement in Wexner constipation score; QOL.

arm_group.description: Patients being treated with sacral neuromodulation with InterStim therapy.

intervention.description: Treatment with InterStim Therapy: all patients meeting inclusion/exclusion criteria undergo test screening and those who have successful outcomes receive a permanent implant.
